shortdescription_s: Create a game on your smartphone and share with friends to try!
longdescription_t: Create your own game on your smart phone with Pocket Code! Help skydiver Steve to deliver his parcels. You can share it with friends and other users to try!

shortdescription_s: Loved the Hour of Code? Explore courses, programming environments, videos and more!
longdescription_t: Loved the Hour of Code but want more? Learn computer science with courses, introductory videos, career exploration and more.
language_s: Arabic, Indonesian, Chinese, Czech, Farsi, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Mongolian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Thai, Turkish, Spanish, Uzbek, Vietnamese, Ukrainian

shortdescription_s: Loved the Hour of Code? Explore courses, programming environments, videos and more!
longdescription_t: Loved the Hour of Code but want more? Learn computer science with courses, introductory videos, career exploration and more.

shortdescription_s: Loved the Hour of Code? Explore courses, programming environments, videos and more!
longdescription_t: Loved the Hour of Code but want more? Learn computer science with courses, introductory videos, career exploration and more.

shortdescription_s: Learn JavaScript programming, in a web-browser
longdescription_t: Codecademy is an interactive, student-guided introduction to the basics of CS through JavaScript that's used by tens of millions of students around the world.

shortdescription_s: Play a game and learn JavaScript to win
longdescription_t: Defeat ogres to learn Python or JavaScript in this epic programming game!

shortdescription_s: Students learn core coding skills with project-based lessons and our unique text-based coding environment.
longdescription_t: Our project-based lessons ensure that students learn core coding skills while they create engaging, interactive programs. We provide teachers with built-in course management, automatic feedback, lesson plans, and more.

shortdescription_s: Dash & Dot are robots that help kids learn the fundamentals of coding.
longdescription_t: Dash & Dot are robots that help kids learn the fundamentals of problem-solving and coding while having fun. They can program the robots to deliver a message, transform into a creature, and follow them around!

shortdescription_s: CompuScholar’s online, turn-key computer science courses enable middle and high schools to confidently teach Java, C#, Python, HTML and Unity game design skills.
longdescription_t: CompuScholar’s turn-key computer science courses are aligned to state/national standards and come with free teacher PD. Student material includes instructional videos, quizzes and tests, and many hands-on programming labs.
platformtext_s: Modern web browsers, Windows or Mac OS

shortdescription_s: Learn Python 3 for free with this interactive course, and get a handle on the most popular programming language in the world
longdescription_t: Learn Python 3, the most popular programming language in the world, for free with this interactive journey through the syntax and functionality of Python. Fun quizzes and coding challenges are included.

shortdescription_s: Enable your students to learn the basics of HTML and CSS by making delicious treats in a virtual bakery.
longdescription_t: Our self-directed micro-lessons enable students to learn the basics of HTML and CSS by making delicious treats in a virtual bakery competing with Supreme Chef Horus for best honors.

shortdescription_s: The most popular class at Harvard
longdescription_t: CS50 is Harvard University's introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming. Topics include algorithms, data structures, security, software engineering, and web development.

shortdescription_s: Basic intro to python programming
longdescription_t: No prior experience is needed to try our unique mix of introductory content and challenges that will bring you to a thorough understanding of the programming language, Python.

shortdescription_s: Learn visual programming on an iPad
longdescription_t: Student-guided tutorial on the iPad using the Hopscotch programming language. Students will build games and apps for their iPad on their iPad. Students can work individually or with friends (up to 3 per iPad).

shortdescription_s: Curious minds of all abilities can create art, games, music and more! Follow guided challenges, remix what others have made, and make original creations from scratch. Hours of challenges available with blocks or simple syntax-based coding languages.
longdescription_t: Curious minds of all abilities can create art, games, music and more! Follow guided challenges, remix what others have made, and make original creations from scratch.

shortdescription_s: Learn to draw in JavaScript
longdescription_t: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!

shortdescription_s: Learn how to use HTML and CSS to make webpages.
longdescription_t: Through a series of interactive challenges and projects, you'll learn how to use HTML and CSS to make web pages.

shortdescription_s: Learn to draw in JavaScript
longdescription_t: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!

shortdescription_s: Learn to program using Ruby
longdescription_t: Have fun and make games, or hack your homework using Ruby! Just tell your parents or teachers you're learning Ruby programming... ;). Free and works on any computer. [Note: Desktop install required]

shortdescription_s: Kids build their own robot, program it with wooden blocks, and decorate it with arts and crafts materials
longdescription_t: Kids build their own robot, program it using wooden blocks, and decorate it with arts and crafts materials - all without a PC, tablet, or smartphone. KIBO invites playful learning and children's creativity and imagination.

shortdescription_s: A fun iPad game to teach computer programming concepts
longdescription_t: Kodable is a self-guided iPad game that introduces kids 5+ to programming basics. Having a teacher or parent nearby is optimal, but not necessary.

name_s: Screen-free Coding with Botley™ the Coding Robot
shortdescription_s: Never coded before? No problem! Botley™ the Coding Robot is ready to use right out of the box and will have you coding in minutes.
longdescription_t: Never coded before? No problem! Botley™ the Coding Robot can be introduced to children as young as 5. Botley is completely screen-free and ready to use right out of the box and will have your child coding in minutes.

shortdescription_s: Build and program a robot
longdescription_t: The endless flexibility of LEGO bricks and the open-ended nature of our curriculum and coding software allows students to explore and develop their ideas as far as their curiosity will take them.

shortdescription_s: A game to teach coding concepts
longdescription_t: Learn core programming logic, starting from super-basic programming, for ages 4+, on iOS or Android (or Web browser) . Learn how to sequence commands, identify patterns, use procedures, and utilize loops!

shortdescription_s: Dozens of online programming courses
longdescription_t: Our developer tutorials can help you learn how to code, create mobile and web applications, work with MySQL databases, get started with the statistical processing language R, and much more. [Note: payment is required]

shortdescription_s: The micro:bit is a fun, handheld, easily programmable computer that uses a web browser to program in blocks, JavaScript or Python.
longdescription_t: The micro:bit is a fun, handheld computer that uses a web browser to program in blocks, JavaScript, or Python. It's simple and easy to use for beginners, while also having advanced features for experienced makers.

name_s: Build Web Apps with .NET and Blazor
shortdescription_s: Build an interactive pizza web application using Blazor, C#, and ASP.NET Core on your computer with free developer tools!
longdescription_t: Build an interactive pizza web application using Blazor, C#, and ASP.NET Core! Through this learning path, you'll see the structure of a web application, learn how to interact with your pizza data, and so much more.

shortdescription_s: Code mobile apps directly on your phone, tablet or laptop
longdescription_t: MakeCode lets you create apps on iPad, iPhone, Android, PC, Mac, Windows Phone. Our touch-friendly editor makes coding fun, even on your phone or tablet!
platformtext_s: Modern web browsers, smartphones, all devices

orgname_s: MIT Center for Mobile Learning @ The Media Lab
shortdescription_s: Make your own app! (Android-only)
longdescription_t: Entertaining, quick video tutorials walk you through building three simple apps for your Android phone or tablet. Designed for novices and experts alike, start building your own apps and share your creations with friends!

shortdescription_s: Ozobot is the tiny robot that makes coding fun and easy with extensive resources for grades K-12.
longdescription_t: Ozobot is the tiny robot that makes coding and computer science fun and easy to learn. Ozobot's introductory lessons will keep students engaged for hours of learning and fun.

shortdescription_s: Learn the Processing languages
longdescription_t: Processing is a programming language, development environment, and online community. Today, tens of thousands of professionals use Processing for learning, prototyping, and production.

shortdescription_s: Build and publish your own games while engaging in STEM learning.
longdescription_t: Roblox is an immersive educational tool where the opportunities for creativity and imagination are limitless. Students will learn coding, design, and entrepreneurial skills.

shortdescription_s: Write code for a virtual robot
longdescription_t: Students learn the basics of programming by controlling their own virtual robot. The online course is fully self-contained with short presentations, movies, quizzes, and automatic hints to help with the programming exercises.

shortdescription_s: Marty is a walking, dancing, soccer-playing robot that's full of character and helps introduce children as young as five to the world of coding in a fun and imaginative way.
longdescription_t: Marty is a walking, dancing, soccer-playing robot that helps introduce children to the world of coding in a fun and imaginative way. Marty is a flexible learning tool that grows with students.

shortdescription_s: Create interactive games, stories, and animations.
longdescription_t: With Scratch, you can create your own interactive games, stories, animations — and share them with your friends. Get started by animating your name, creating a holiday card, or making a pong game.

shortdescription_s: Create interactive games, stories, and animations.
longdescription_t: With Scratch, you can create your own interactive games, stories, animations — and share them with your friends. Get started by animating your name, creating a holiday card, or making a pong game.

shortdescription_s: Create interactive stories and games using ScratchJr.
longdescription_t: ScratchJr is an introductory programming language that enables children to create their own interactive stories and games. Children snap together graphical programming blocks to make characters move, jump, dance, and sing.

shortdescription_s: SPRK lessons give kids a fun crash course in programming robots while sharpening skills in math and science.
longdescription_t: Designed to inspire curiosity and creativity, SPRK+ is far more than just a robot. Powered by Sphero Edu, you can easily learn programming, complete hands-on activities, and share your creations with the community.

shortdescription_s: Students can use their TI graphing calculators to learn to code in either Python or TI-BASIC with free short 10 minute lessons.
longdescription_t: Students can use their TI graphing calculators to learn to code in either Python or TI-BASIC with free short 10 minute lessons.
platformtext_s: Modern web browsers, any TI graphing calculator

shortdescription_s: Teach programming in a 3D environment
longdescription_t: The Alice Project provides tools and materials for teaching and learning computational thinking, problem-solving, and computer programming to create 3D animations.

shortdescription_s: Enroll in a Trilogy-powered bootcamp.
longdescription_t: If you're 18+ with a high school diploma or GED, apply now for a Trilogy-powered bootcamp. Programs include coding, data, design & cybersecurity.

shortdescription_s: A fun and engaging course for children in grades 4-9
longdescription_t: Tynker makes it fun & easy to learn programming. Kids build games and mobile apps by arranging blocks of code and transforming ideas into animated stories and math art right away. Tynker promotes progressive learning.

shortdescription_s: A fun and engaging course for children in grades 4-8
longdescription_t: Tynker makes it fun & easy to learn programming. Kids build games and mobile apps by arranging blocks of code and transforming ideas into animated stories and math art right away. Tynker promotes progressive learning.

shortdescription_s: Dozens of online programming courses
longdescription_t: Whether you've never seen a line of code or you code for a living, Udemy has a course for you, taught by professional instructors. [Note: payment is required]

shortdescription_s: Learn JavaScript by bringing your photos and videos to life.
longdescription_t: Learn JavaScript by bringing your photos and videos to life. Create filters, graphics, emojis, and special effects with step-by-step project tutorials. Learn code through something teens & tweens love.

shortdescription_s: Learn to make web sites
longdescription_t: Learn to create websites on your own computer. Learn the server basics in less than a day. Learn to add databases to your website

shortdescription_s: Learn to make web sites
longdescription_t: Learn to create websites on your own computer. Learn the server basics in less than a day. Learn to add databases to your website
